body:
(Replying to @minux's comments from the aforementioned CL.)

> I suggest that if we're going to do this, we start from go1, so
> it will be painless for users to stay on the branch and switch
> versions at will.

What's the benefit of going all the way back? `git checkout <tag>` will take you to whatever release you're looking for. The sole purpose of the proposed `release` branch is to make `git checkout release` and/or `git pull` work cleanly to give you the latest stable release. 

> There is one question though, should future go1.x tags point
> to the major version specific release branch or the new release
> branch? I can see arguments from both sides.

IMO the tags should continue point to the relevant commits in the release-branch. Those are the canonical commits. The `release` branch is just a convenience.
